apps.title: Helperbird
apps.description: Helperbird is your all-in-one accessibility tool, making browsing, reading, and writing on the web easier.

apps.title: Coffee & Fun LLC
apps.description: Coffee & Fun build software that’s functional, fun, and accessible, making a real difference in the digital world.

apps.title: Simple Screenshot Pro
apps.description: Simple Screenshot Pro makes screen capturing a breeze with one-click efficiency. No more tedious scrolling or combining images. Capture entire webpages or just the visible parts with ease and precision.

apps.title: Markdown Editor for Chrome
apps.description: Markdown Editor makes writing easy. Whether it's on GitHub, Twitch, or any code editor, this premium editor fits right into your browser, supporting all popular coding languages.

apps.title: Netflix Hidden Categories for Chrome
apps.description: Unlock all Netflix categories, including the hidden ones. Explore over 5000 categories and find your next binge-watch.

apps.title: Incognito Bear
apps.description: With one click, Incognito Bear removes all NSFW content or a custom list from your browsing history, letting you browse worry-free.

apps.title: Instant Flash Cards
apps.description: Turn any site into study vibes with one click. Instant Flash Cards is your hack to making learning stick.

talks.title: The Blurred Line Between Websites and Web Apps

podcasts.title: The Blurred Line Between Websites and Web Apps

history.title: Founder
history.description: My company where I build apps and browser extensions. We focus on making software that's actually useful and accessible to everyone.

history.title: Founder
history.description: Started Helperbird as a side project and grew it into an accessibility app used by over a million people across Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari, and Google Docs.

history.title: Owner and Author
history.description: Freelance consulting work, helping companies with JavaScript, Node.js, Golang, and PHP projects. A mix of frontend and backend work.

history.title: Team Lead and Software Engineer
history.description: Led a team of six devs rebuilding the frontend and backend of the Teamwork.com websites. Also built analytics tools to personalise the experience for new and returning users.

history.title: Software Engineer
history.description: Built a bunch of data importers for Teamwork Projects. Added Google sign-up and login support and worked on new features and UX improvements.

history.title: Software Engineer (Part-time)
history.description: Worked part-time on the Teamwork.com websites while finishing my CS degree. Mostly frontend work — sign-up flows, new features, and UX improvements.

history.title: Web Engineer (Internship)
history.description: My first proper job in tech. Built new pages and features for the Teamwork.com marketing site and CMS. This is where I really learned the ropes.

history.title: Software Engineer
history.description: Built custom encryption for password resets and worked on new features. Also did a lot of code reviews.

history.title: Software Engineer
history.description: Built a social website for Autism Start from scratch — a community platform with original content, social features, and tools for their users.

history.title: Software Developer (Internship)
history.description: Built an internal website for EMC employees with account creation, search, and a mentor matching feature.

history.title: Software Developer (Internship)
history.description: Learned a lot about networking and servers. Redesigned the Visitors Portal website and added social sharing and video features.

history.title: Web Developer (Internship)
history.description: Got invited to the Microsoft workshop after the National Young Scientist competition. Short but I learned a ton about how things work at a company like Microsoft.

history.title: Web Developer (Internship)
history.description: Built circuit boards and wrote C++ code for chips. My first taste of hardware and R&D — very different from web dev but I loved it.
